abstract: When concerns about a pipeline were dismissed by regulators, a rural black enclave went to court — and won.
lead_paragraph: In the years following the Civil War, freedmen and freedwomen founded a community close to the Virginia plantations where they had been enslaved. The settlers of Union Hill in Buckingham County, Va., passed down this land over generations to today’s descendants, who are now at the center of a fight to stop a proposed multibillion dollar energy project.
